name: camera.on()
content:
Activates the camera. The display area will be drawn according to the camera position and scale until `camera.off()` is called.

The camera enables scrolling and zooming for scenes extending beyond the display area. A camera has a position, a zoom factor, and mouse coordinates relative to the view. The camera is automatically created and available for use.

examples.description: Hold the mouse down to activate the camera and link to the sprite movement.

examples.name: Follow the Alien
examples.description: Link the camera to the main sprite movement and scroll stationary sprites.

return_value: No return value. Possibly changes output in the display after drawSprites() is called.
short_description: Activates the camera. The display area will be drawn according to the camera position and scale until camera.off() is called.
tips: - The camera is automatically turned on at the start of each `draw()` loop.
